medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent auditory hallucinations and paranoid delusions.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. A first developed auditory hallucinations in August 2006, which progressed to a nearly constant voice by November 2006. The symptoms persisted despite stopping illicit drug use in February 2007, and he experienced worsening depression, difficulties with concentration, and suicidal ideation. Following his first treatment, he had symptom remission but relapsed into methamphetamine use, leading to a recurrence of psychotic symptoms in May 2008.
medical_history.family_history: One second-degree relative (paternal uncle) with bipolar disorder; no family history of psychiatric disorder in first-degree relatives.
medical_history.social_history: Mr. A reported usage of methamphetamine starting in 2003, gradually increasing to daily use by 2005, alongside infrequent alcohol consumption. He had a graduate education, stable employment, and lived a sober lifestyle after treatment.
